verses.verse: But now they that are <S%H6810>younger<s%> <S%H3117><s%> than I have me in <S%H7832>derision<s%>, whose <S%H1>fathers<s%> I would have <S%H3988>disdained<s%> to have <S%H7896>set<s%> with the <S%H3611>dogs<s%> of my <S%H6629>flock<s%>. younger: Heb. of fewer days than I
Yea, <S%H4100>whereto<s%> might the <S%H3581>strength<s%> of their <S%H3027>hands<s%> profit me, in whom old <S%H3624>age<s%> was <S%H6>perished<s%>?

For <S%H2639>want<s%> and <S%H3720>famine<s%> they were <S%H1565>solitary<s%>; <S%H6207>fleeing<s%> into the <S%H6723>wilderness<s%> in former <S%H570>time<s%> <S%H7722>desolate<s%> and <S%H4875>waste<s%>. solitary: or, dark as the night in: Heb. yesternight
Who cut <S%H6998>up<s%> <S%H4408>mallows<s%> by the <S%H7880>bushes<s%>, and <S%H7574>juniper<s%> <S%H8328>roots<s%> for their <S%H3899>meat<s%>.
They were driven <S%H1644>forth<s%> from <S%H1460>among<s%> men, (they <S%H7321>cried<s%> after them as after a <S%H1590>thief<s%>;)
To <S%H7931>dwell<s%> in the <S%H6178>clifts<s%> of the <S%H5158>valleys<s%>, in <S%H2356>caves<s%> of the <S%H6083>earth<s%>, and in the <S%H3710>rocks<s%>. caves: Heb. holes
Among the <S%H7880>bushes<s%> they <S%H5101>brayed<s%>; under the <S%H2738>nettles<s%> they were gathered <S%H5596>together<s%>.
They were <S%H1121>children<s%> of <S%H5036>fools<s%>, yea, <S%H1121>children<s%> of base <S%H8034>men<s%>: they were <S%H5217>viler<s%> than the <S%H776>earth<s%>. base: Heb. men of no name
And now am I their <S%H5058>song<s%>, yea, I am their <S%H4405>byword<s%>.
They <S%H8581>abhor<s%> me, they flee <S%H7368>far<s%> from me, and <S%H2820>spare<s%> not to <S%H7536>spit<s%> in my <S%H6440>face<s%>. and: Heb. and withhold not spittle from
Because he hath <S%H6605>loosed<s%> my <S%H3499>cord<s%>, and <S%H6031>afflicted<s%> me, they have also let <S%H7971>loose<s%> the <S%H7448>bridle<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> me.

Upon my <S%H3225>right<s%> hand <S%H6965>rise<s%> the <S%H6526>youth<s%>; they push <S%H7971>away<s%> my <S%H7272>feet<s%>, and they raise <S%H5549>up<s%> against me the <S%H734>ways<s%> of their <S%H343>destruction<s%>.
They <S%H5420>mar<s%> my <S%H5410>path<s%>, they set <S%H3276>forward<s%> my <S%H1942>calamity<s%> <S%H1962><s%>, they have no <S%H5826>helper<s%>.
They <S%H857>came<s%> upon me as a <S%H7342>wide<s%> <S%H6556>breaking<s%> in of waters: <S%H8478>in<s%> the <S%H7722>desolation<s%> they <S%H1556>rolled<s%> themselves upon me.

<S%H1091>Terrors<s%> are <S%H2015>turned<s%> upon me: they <S%H7291>pursue<s%> my <S%H5082>soul<s%> as the <S%H7307>wind<s%>: and my <S%H3444>welfare<s%> passeth <S%H5674>away<s%> as a <S%H5645>cloud<s%>. my soul: Heb. my principal one
And now my <S%H5315>soul<s%> is poured <S%H8210>out<s%> upon me; the <S%H3117>days<s%> of <S%H6040>affliction<s%> have taken <S%H270>hold<s%> upon me.
My <S%H6106>bones<s%> are <S%H5365>pierced<s%> in me in the night <S%H3915>season<s%>: and my <S%H6207>sinews<s%> take no <S%H7901>rest<s%>.
By the <S%H7230>great<s%> <S%H3581>force<s%> of my disease is my <S%H3830>garment<s%> <S%H2664>changed<s%>: it bindeth me <S%H247>about<s%> as the <S%H6310>collar<s%> of my <S%H3801>coat<s%>.
He hath <S%H3384>cast<s%> me into the <S%H2563>mire<s%>, and I am become <S%H4911>like<s%> <S%H6083>dust<s%> and <S%H665>ashes<s%>.
I <S%H7768>cry<s%> unto thee, and thou dost not <S%H6030>hear<s%> me: I stand <S%H5975>up<s%>, and thou <S%H995>regardest<s%> me not.

Thou art <S%H2015>become<s%> <S%H393>cruel<s%> to me: with thy <S%H6108>strong<s%> <S%H3027>hand<s%> thou <S%H7852>opposest<s%> thyself against me. become: Heb. turned to be cruel thy: Heb. the strength of thy hand
Thou liftest me <S%H5375>up<s%> to the <S%H7307>wind<s%>; thou causest me to <S%H7392>ride<s%> upon it, and <S%H4127>dissolvest<s%> my <S%H8454>substance<s%> <S%H7738><s%>. substance: or, wisdom
For I <S%H3045>know<s%> that thou wilt <S%H7725>bring<s%> me to <S%H4194>death<s%>, and to the <S%H1004>house<s%> <S%H4150>appointed<s%> for all <S%H2416>living<s%>.
Howbeit he will not stretch <S%H7971>out<s%> his <S%H3027>hand<s%> to the <S%H1164>grave<s%>, though they <S%H7769>cry<s%> in his <S%H6365>destruction<s%>. grave: Heb. heap
Did not I <S%H1058>weep<s%> for him that was in <S%H7186>trouble<s%> <S%H3117><s%>? was not my <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H5701>grieved<s%> for the <S%H34>poor<s%>? in trouble: Heb. hard of day?
When I <S%H6960>looked<s%> for <S%H2896>good<s%>, then <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H935>came<s%> unto me: and when I <S%H3176>waited<s%> for <S%H216>light<s%>, there <S%H935>came<s%> <S%H652>darkness<s%>.
My <S%H4578>bowels<s%> <S%H7570>boiled<s%>, and <S%H1826>rested<s%> not: the <S%H3117>days<s%> of <S%H6040>affliction<s%> <S%H6923>prevented<s%> me.
I <S%H1980>went<s%> <S%H6937>mourning<s%> without the <S%H2535>sun<s%>: I stood <S%H6965>up<s%>, and I <S%H7768>cried<s%> in the <S%H6951>congregation<s%>.
I am a <S%H251>brother<s%> to <S%H8577>dragons<s%>, and a <S%H7453>companion<s%> to <S%H1323>owls<s%> <S%H3284><s%>. owls: or, ostriches
My <S%H5785>skin<s%> is <S%H7835>black<s%> upon me, and my <S%H6106>bones<s%> are <S%H2787>burned<s%> with <S%H2721>heat<s%>.
My <S%H3658>harp<s%> also is turned to <S%H60>mourning<s%>, and my <S%H5748>organ<s%> into the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of them that <S%H1058>weep<s%>.
